racecards.race_name: BetWright Bet The Wright Way Mares' "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Second in her last bumper and the winner ran well on Friday's hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Went close in her third bumper at Newton Abbot (good) and the winner ran well on his hurdling debut at Chepstow on Friday, so that form has substance.

runners.comment: Bumper runs weren't too bad but finished tailed off on recent hurdling debut when 25-1
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred filly; bumper runs weren't too bad but finished tailed off on recent hurdling debut when 25-1.

runners.comment: Made a noise when tailed off in her bumper; had wind op and now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Reportedly made a noise when tailed off in a good-ground bumper at Huntingdon (16-1) and has since had wind surgery (also tongue tied here); likely best watched.

runners.comment: Similar sort of form in three good-ground bumpers, latterly in a hood
runners.spotlight: Similar sort of form in three good-ground bumpers, latterly in a hood; entitled to have a say in this company if taking to hurdles.

runners.comment: Second run over hurdles but was better than the first but probably needs to improve again
runners.spotlight: Hasn't kicked on from bumper debut; second run over hurdles but was better than the first but probably needs to improve again.

runners.comment: Had four runs over hurdles and wasn't beaten far in any of them; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Had four runs over hurdles and wasn't beaten far in any of them, on ground from soft to good; unlikely to be far away.

runners.owner: Awr Ltd Sperling Snowden Morley & Stacey
runners.comment: Hooded for bumper win but not when third behind respected opposition on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Hooded for bumper win but not when third behind respected opposition on hurdling debut (2m, good); would have been closer without a mistake or two; every chance.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Scientific Fillies' 'Junior' National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ride Like A Girl has plenty of speed and might not have quite liked the soft ground she has encountered until now - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's a lovely young horse. She ran well when second at Stratford last week and will improve from it. 06-11-24

runners.comment: RPRs in the 70s when never that dangerous in bumpers here and at Stratford
runners.spotlight: RPRs in the 70s when never that dangerous in bumpers here and at Stratford; has some ability but perhaps one for further down the line.

racecards.verdict: It was probably a better race in which RIDE LIKE A GIRL ran third at Warwick and she'd have been closer without mistakes.
racecards.betting_forecast: 15/8 Ride Like A Girl, 7/2 Lady Kara, 5/1 Border Gem,  Ninna Collina, 8/1 Midnight Pass, 10/1 Windsor Blue, 20/1 Indigo Blu, 25/1 For Love Of Beauty

racecards.race_name: BetWright Bangers N'Cash Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Consistent since sent hurdling and was well on top at Warwick 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Hasn't done much wrong at all since sent over hurdles and was well on top at Warwick 12 days ago (2m, good); has the penalty but looks sure to be involved.

runners.comment: Won a Worcester novice hurdle in June and since done well at modest level on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Won a Worcester novice hurdle in June (2m, good to soft) and won four times on the Flat since then, including latest start nine days ago; Flat wins have been at a modest level but confidence must be high.

runners.comment: Had his consistency rewarded with a narrow maiden victory at Newton Abbot; penalised
runners.spotlight: Had his consistency rewarded with a narrow maiden victory at Newton Abbot (2m2f, good); it's not strong form and he carries a penalty, but no reason why he won't run well.

runners.comment: Beat a good horse in his Irish point; making steady progress under rules
runners.spotlight: Beat a good horse in his Irish point; making steady progress under rules, last time chasing home the odds-on favourite in a 2m maiden on good ground at Warwick; should be bang there.

runners.comment: Useful Flat performer who could make a hurdler and Sean Bowen rides
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat performer at up to 1m4f for Kevin Ryan and signed off for him when a near miss at Doncaster in July; well beaten in two Flat runs for current yard, albeit in good handicaps; could make a hurdler and Sean Bowen rides.

quotes.quote: Ryan [Moore] said he just jumped a little bit awkwardly and that they didn't go as quickly as they might have. Marhaba The Champ was running a little bit free with him but he relaxed and let him fill up. He's done it well and that was a class ride. He'll probably get further but needs to relax a bit more. That's an avenue for the future but we'll probably stick to this trip for now - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

We thought Marhaba The Champ would run a big race and William (Buick) gave him a fantastic ride. He's a horse we like a lot, we've just been waiting for the ground. He loves quick ground without any juice in it at all - it's so important to him. I could see him going a bit further in time - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a cracking horse and looks to have done well again over the winter. He loves York and fast ground so we'll aim him at the Dante meeting, but we could explore going up in trip at some stage this season. 04-04-24

racecards.verdict: The 6yo BIG BOY BARNEY beat a Graded performer in his Irish point and appears to be making progress under rules.
racecards.betting_forecast: 9/4 Big Boy Barney, 11/4 Jackstell, 3/1 Whatyouwaitingfor, 11/2 Spartan Times,  Marhaba The Champ

runners.breeder: E Puerari, A Gravereaux Et Al
runners.owner: O T I Racing Syndicate, Maughold Racing Syndicate Et Al

quotes.quote: Deakin has been working well and we always thought plenty of him early on in the year. He's gelded now and it's made a big difference. He's very versatile and I don't think he'll have any problem stepping up in trip. He's progressing and when these horses turn a corner like he has done, you never know when they're going to stop improving. He's going to be exciting next year I think - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second on his reappearance at the Curragh last month and we're looking forward to running him. 12-06-24

runners.owner: G Evans, Mrs C O Bamford Et Al
A Kheir, Qatar Bloodstock Ltd Et Al

quotes.quote: Via Sistina is definitely good. It takes a good one to beat the big boy [Romantic Warrior] though, but she's well up there and she turns up each and every time, which I'm so proud of her because if she was going to get beat, it could have been easily a race like this. As we've seen she's getting more versatile. It felt like it was a mile race. She was really tanking up and hence the bead of sweat, so I've earned my money - James McDonald, jockey.

Via Sistina is right up there. She has done amazing things. She won her first start in Australia, she won a Winx Stakes over 1,400 metres, she won a Turnbull and she won a Cox Plate, breaking the track record by a big margin. Now she's backed it up here today. Take out her only defeat, which was on a heavy track, and she has been unbeaten in Australia. That is pretty remarkable - Chris Waller, trainer.

It was a Winx-like performance. I can't believe it. What this mare has been through; Via Sistina is just an absolute star. I'm so lucky to be a part of it - James McDonald, jockey, speaking to Racing.com.

quotes.race: Sumbe Prix Jean Romanet (Group 1) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Round Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Via Sistina has run a blinder again and it's not taken much out of her, she just got a bit lonely in front. I think we'll probably come back for the Opera on Arc day. It looks the right race for her as she's a filly who handles all types of ground. It'll probably be her last race, but she's done amazing and has only just come into herself. She's a very good filly - George Boughey, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Falmouth Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: It was the step back to a mile and Via Sistina just got tapped for toe. Jamie only gave her one flick and I was pleased to see her stay on well as she looked like she was booked for fifth or sixth at one point, but up the hill she stayed on well all the way. She'll have a bit of a break now and then we'll prep her for the autumn back to ten furlongs. You won't see her over a mile again - George Boughey, trainer.

It's unlike her as she's never hung before. Once I saw the head-on I wasn't too concerned but you'd rather win more smoothly. I had a plan going out to jump smartly and sit third but Via Sistina bobbed the gate and it was straight to plan B. I wasn't very comfortable for the first six furlongs of the race but, once I got her around the turn into the straight and went past one on the outside, she came alive. I was in business then - Jamie Spencer, jockey.

The ground is key to Via Sistina, she's got a hell of a turn of foot in soft ground. Her work is good on decent ground but it's a lot better on softer ground. It didn't come as a huge surprise when the rain started to fall, we were pretty happy. I think even the back end of last year we were talking about the Prix de l'Opera on Arc day for her. That's a realistic possibility as it's been soft however many times on that day and we'll work back from that. The Pretty Polly Stakes on Irish Derby Day is quite possibly the next step - George Boughey, trainer.

Via Sistina is a very good filly. It just didn't quite happen on her French trip . She came back a little bit low and we just sat and bided our time and give her a break. When the ground comes right she is a very good filly and I'm sure she is a black type filly. She handles that ground very well. Hopefully she doesn't get sold like a lot of my good ones do. She is as big as house and she will only improve with time. She was too keen in France and the plan was to miss the kick and drop her in and there is no better man in the country than Jamie Spencer if you are going to do that - Joseph Tuite, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She had been on my radar long before she joined us in the autumn. She was in training with Joe Tuite and landed a nice touch for them at Newmarket in a big handicap off 89 and when I heard Joe was retiring, I hoped we might acquire her and when I got the phone call saying she was coming to us I was absolutely delighted. I have spoken to Joe about her, and he has been a big help. She was a very big raw filly when she got here but is maturing all the time. She ran a lovely race first time for me when a fast-finishing second in the Group 3 Pride Stakes behind Creative Flair before opening her Group-race account at Toulouse in the Prix Fille de l'Air in November over 1m2½f. She enjoyed a good winter, and I had the Group 2 Dahlia Stakes as her intended target, but I needed soft ground. I remember looking up to the sky on 2,000 Guineas day and being delighted at the amount of rain that fell as every drop aided her cause the following day, and she romped in, coming home six lengths clear of Al Husn, who subsequently impressed with a Listed success. She won't get her ground next week at Royal Ascot and I'm not going to risk her on anything other than ground she relishes. She is a Group 1 filly in the making and my main objective this season for her is the Prix de l'Opera on Arc weekend. She has an entry in next month's Pretty Polly Stakes at the Curragh, but the ground there is riding very quick at the moment. I'm not sure what her best trip is yet and we could even consider the Arc if everything went right. 14-06-23

runners.breeder: Sarl De Chambure Haras D'Etreham Et Al

quotes.race: Comer Group International Irish St. Leger (Group 1)
quotes.quote: I fancied Al Riffa as the conditions and trip were good and he had a lovely set-up. Things couldn't have gone better. There was plenty of speed on in the first half of the race, he relaxes well and has got a good kick when you need it. I was able to take my time and he quickened up and won well.  He feels like he could go another couple of furlongs and the world is his oyster now. He's one of my favourites and owes me nothing - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

That was brilliant. Al Riffa has got a lot of class and he was last to first in a National Stakes here. No one ever felt that he needed that trip but it made sense. He was very relaxed and Dylan said he was a very easy ride over that trip. I'd say it's most likely that he'll go straight to the Irish St Leger from here. There is a possibility of the Pries Von Berlin he won last year but I'd say it's more likely he'll go straight to the Irish Leger. The Melbourne Cup is in the mind thereafter. We all know what comes with that but it's what we'd like to do, if we're allowed - Kevin Blake, stable representative.

Fantastic run, probably unlucky to meet a horse like Rebel Romance in that race, but we're very proud of Al Riffa, who is a real star for us and he's run his legs off for us again today. Hopefully there will be plenty more big days with him to come this season. He's a beautiful horse and he always runs to a rating not too far off 120, and it's hard to find horses like that. Obviously he's a multiple Group One winner and we were probably unlucky to meet a real champion in the Hardwicke. Rebels' Romance is one of the best horses in the world over the last number of years. I wouldn't be against trying a little bit further with him as well - he's got plenty of stamina in his pedigree. I think we'll probably think outside the box with him a little bit now - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

Al Riffa ran a really good race and came home strong. It was his first race, so he was entitled to that. We are delighted with him and we'll see how he pulls up and make plans from there - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

It's been a wonderful day and Al Riffa put up a really good performance so we're very proud. Dylan [Browne McMonagle] gave the horse a fantastic ride. He's had a busy season so far, racing in France, Britain, America and now Germany, so I think he'll have a little rest and then be prepared for the Arc - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

We'll probably make the rest of the season all about the Arc, which will be his main target. Al Riffa should enjoy the mile and a half as his family is all stamina. It looked like mile and a half will suit him on his run today - Jospeh O'Brien, trainer.

Al Riffa ran great. It was a tactical race, but I'm very proud of his run and looking forward to his season ahead. He came there with a strong run and maybe got a bit tired. He's a big colt and hopefully he has a long season ahead. He has options and the Tattersalls Gold Cup or the Prix d'Ispahan would be two obvious races for his next start. Also we're keen to explore 12 furlongs as we think the Arc is a longer-term target so we'll be plotting our route to there - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

Obviously the winner is a champion and we're very close to him. Christophe liked Al Riffa a lot and we've a lot to look forward to. The last run was decent but it's nice to see him back to his two-year-old form today, and he finished very well. It was good to keep him against three-year-olds again before taking on older horses next time, which will probably be in the Irish Champion Stakes. We'll look at the Champion Stakes afterwards - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Vincent O'Brien National Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: It was a special performance. Al Riffa won his maiden well and the owners were keen to supplement him for this. It was a very impressive performance to come from the back of the field like that. He was a big shell of a horse as a yearling and I thought he'd make a lovely 3yo, I didn't for a minute think he'd make the two-year-old that he has made. His family is all stamina, so for him to be doing this at this stage is very positive for the future. We always thought he was a middle-distance horse, and he's closely related to an Ascot Gold Cup winner, so that's real stamina, but he's not slow. I'd imagine he's a Guineas horse for sure and we'll take it from there. He's a classy horse and very exciting. The plan coming here was to go on to the race on Arc day (the Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere) but we'll see how he comes out of it today and discuss it with the owners - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: John Ormonde Wexford Sand Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Al Riffa is a grand horse. He was first off it, niggling, but he's a big horse and still immature. The future is bright, he could be anything. He goes on quick ground for a big horse but he might just be better with a bit of cut in it. The National Stakes has been mentioned. I think he'll be a cracking three-year-old - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He drops in grade and goes in the Hardwicke. He's been running consistently well at a high level and I think the drop in class should give him a live chance. 13-06-25

A smart horse and, after a particularly catching run on his debut when a fast-finishing second to Hans Anderson, he won his maiden at the Curragh as we expected. His work after that improved and we felt he was worth his place in the Group 1 National Stakes which he won very nicely from my brother Donnacha's colt Proud And Regal. That was his last run of the campaign and he looks a much stronger three-year-old this year, more the finished product. He was our nicest juvenile last year and carries our hopes this year. The plan will be to have his first run in the Irish Guineas at the end of May and we will then stick to the mile for his next run. After that, depending on how he is doing, I may consider stepping him up to 1m2f, but I don't see him taking up his Derby entry. His pedigree and the work he is doing where he shows a lot of pace says he is quick enough to stick to the mile. He has been doing all we have asked him this spring and I'm looking forward to getting him out on the track again. 12-04-23

runners.owner: A Kheir, Qatar Bloodstock Ltd Et Al

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Heritage Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Buckaroo was really straightforward, he had lovely form last year. Joseph identified this race about a month ago so it has been the plan for some time. It was a sit and sprint sort of race, and I loved the way he battled when a very good filly came to him. He has admirable qualities and I hope the best is to come from him - Oisin Murphy, rider.
Buckaroo might go for the Beresford Stakes. He's a massive horse and can only get better. He has a big future - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He wasn't beaten far in the Prix d'Ispahan at Longchamp last time and has come out of that run in good shape. He looks to have a good chance and we're looking forward to running him. 16-6-23

He is a very smart colt who was progressing nicely going into the Irish 2,000 Guineas last season. We thought he would go very well in the Classic but he got quite sick after that and we could not run him again all season. His owners have been very patient and their patience was rewarded as he won a thriller last week when beating the high-class Homeless Songs in a Listed race at Leopardstown. If things were to progress how I hope then the Prix d'Ispahan could be an option. We are excited about his prospects this season and hope he can fulfil his potential. He will run between 1m and 1m2f with his best probably the latter. 12-04-23

runners.owner: Bjorn Baker Racing, C E Holt Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
X-Men Racing LLC, Madaket Stables LLC & SF Racing LLC
Lanni Bloodstock, Madaket Stables LLC & SF Racing LLC
X-Men Racing LLC, Madaket Stables LLC & SF Racing LLC

quotes.race: Maker's Mark Breeders' Cup Filly & Mare Turf (Grade 1) (3yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Moira broke well and I was able to get myself close to the rail going into the first turn. It felt like the pace was slow, and on the backside I didn't want anyone to get the move on me. I decided to get out and get myself closer and try to get the jump on everybody and it worked out - Flavien Prat, jockey.

runners.breeder: P Decouz & S C E A Du Bas Bugey
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, Ab Vauban Et Al

quotes.quote: We're disappointed again. Vauban looked like a picture in the mounting yard and was ready to rock. William said from halfway he was flat out and I think we did well to finish eleventh. For whatever reason he just doesn't seem to travel down here well and we're puzzled. Maybe we should stay here, I don't know. I'll talk to Willie and we'll have to figure out what to do as I'm not sure what we can do in Europe with him - Rich Ricci, owner alongside wife Susannah.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Hamilton Lonsdale Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Two miles on the Flat is his optimum trip. Vauban got there so easily and I ended up getting there too soon. He was idling but he did enough. He's a class horse - William Buick, rider. The plan must be to go to Melbourne now. We said we'd work back from it and I don't know what we do next - he is in the Irish St Leger - but Australia remains the plan. He was very, very good today - Rich Ricci, joint-owner.

I think we got plan A working very well; Colin got Vauban in a nice position settled on the rails. Everything opened up for him nicely and it looked like he didn't stay against that calibre of animal. Kyprios is probably special and in a lesser two-and-a-half-mile race he'd probably have his chance. I think we're going back. I was happy enough with that run to go back to Melbourne. It's a half-mile shorter and he goes on the ground. When you have a horse who goes on that ground, you take your chance. He'll have at least one run before, maybe two - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Yorkshire Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was delighted, they'll be very happy with that. Vauban is going to get further and he felt he was going to improve for that so there are plenty of positives to take from it - William Buick, jockey.

Vauban was beaten too far out for my liking. When I saw him coming to the six-furlong marker and Ryan had to give him a squeeze, I thought 'that's not great'. He should have been cantering at that stage. He just flattened out and ran very disappointingly. He didn't fire on the day. Maybe it was the heat - Willie Mullins, trainer.

I wasn't worried about the drop in trip for Vauban as he'd won a Listed event in France a couple of years ago over a mile and a half and, although further suits him better, we were confident enough it wouldn't pose a problem. Colin (Keane) said it was straightforward. They went a nice even gallop, which suited him and a little bit of juice in the ground suited him well and he picked up well in the straight. He had to run in the first three today to tick that box to pass the ballot for the Melbourne Cup, so he's done that now. Willie will decide in the next few weeks what he's going to do with him - David Casey, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

I didn't expect to be in front, but I got Vauban out okay and nobody else wanted to be in front. They told me he stays very well and I felt I had to keep building the pace. He got into a good rhythm and stretched all the way to the line. He's a very smart horse. He won a Listed race on the Flat in France and he was in a handicap here and he's done what he's done jumping. I'd say today was a bit of a shock to him making the running, but he got the job done very well - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Ballymore Champion Four Year Old Hurdle (Juvenile) (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban is able to get down and hurdle properly now. He settled well and was able to change gear. He looks hugely exciting - Willie Mullins, trainer

I'll have a word with Rich (Ricci), but I imagine what we'll do is hurdle this first season then give them the summer off, hurdle next season and then go Flat racing after that and I'd love to win the Melbourne Cup, but that might be in 2023. Punchestown could be next - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV "12 Euros Per Month This Weekend Only" Spring Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Vauban had a very good run at Punchestown. Paul got his jumping together and he has improved. That puts him in the Triumph picture. He put it all together today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It's very hard for five-year-olds in their second season to compete with the older horses, so I'm hoping he'll be the finished article next season 14-2-23

He was the top juvenile hurdler last season, winning the Triumph and two other Grade 1s. The following season is always a tough one for five-year-olds and he has run with real credit in his two runs behind State Man. He's in the Champion Hurdle and will run well, but I'd hope next season, when he's the finished article, he'll be a serious contender for top honours. 08-03-23

runners.breeder: Nearco Stud Ltd & Rich Hill Thoroughbreds Ltd
runners.owner: Star Thoroughbreds Pty Ltd, Boeara Holdings Et Al
Paolo Zambelli, Carlo Pellegatti Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mme Rana Khaddam, Carlo Pellegatti Et Al

quotes.quote: I was quite confident beforehand because Presage Nocturne seemed so well, but they only hacked and, although he can sprint, it wasn't ideal for him. We have several options now, and he could go to America or else target the new Group 1 here [the Prix Vicomtesse Vigier]. He has never stopped improving - Alessandro Botti, trainer.

runners.owner: Go Bloodstock Australia, A J N Brooks Et Al

quotes.quote: Delius had been working incredibly well before this race and looked awesome the whole week. He has improved with every run and I guarantee he still has a lot of room for improvement. The Grand Prix de Paris could be next, but we would not want to run him on firm ground on a hot day, so we will play it by ear. There are some important races coming up in the autumn and we want to have him ready for that. He is a very, very good one and we are blessed to have him- Jean-Claude Rouget, trainer.

quotes.race: Highclere Thoroughbred Racing Geoffrey Freer Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Furthur ran a stellar race at Ascot when he was narrowly beaten in the Queen's Vase and we had big hopes in the Bahrain Trophy, but it probably came too soon for him. He's had a nice break since and that was more like him. He's not an overly enthusiastic horse in the morning, but he relaxed beautifully and Oisin rode him lovely. I'm very pleased - Andrew Balding, trainer.

Furthur wasn't an expensive horse and he's given us a huge amount of enjoyment. Hopefully there's more to come as well. We might look at the Bahrain Trophy if he comes out of this alright. He stays well, and might be a Leger horse later in the year - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.owner: N Morgan & D H T Devine

quotes.quote: I didn't want to be back at the field, but as I said before the race, Middle Earth is a bit of a slow starter. He travelled on and finished very well. He ran home the last three furlongs in, I'd imagine, the quickest time of the race, so you have to be grateful for that. He's probably run up to his rating. It wouldn't surprise me if he went to the King George, but it would be lovely to win a Group Two on the way to more difficult races - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Aston Park Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The Melbourne Cup is the plan. We can run Middle Earth a couple more times here and then aim down there. The Hardwicke would be the most likely place to go [next] but we won't over-race him. He hated the ground in last season's St Leger, it was too loose, so if they get one of those downpours in Melbourne you might as well stay in the hotel - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Troy Asset Management Noel Murless Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Middle Earth seems to stay well but he's not one-paced and ran some decent sectionals in the Melrose and he's one I like. I would entertain coming back to a mile and a half next season but maybe something like the Sagaro could be a good starting point and see where we go from there - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Cocked Hat Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: \BMeydaan\P has been learning his trade as he's gone along this season and he deserved to get his head in front. He was in front soon enough and was looking around a bit but saw out the trip well. He has options at Royal Ascot, including the Queen's Vase, and we'll have a chat with connections - Simon Crisford, joint trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is very progressive and following a gelding operation he came out at Newcastle last month and won with ease by five and a half lengths off his opening mark of 76. The handicapper raised him 11lb on the back of that impressive effort, which I can understand. Even after the gelding operation he still seemed very gormless at Newcastle until Danny [Muscutt] grabbed hold of him. He will progress with racing experience and there is more to come from him. 29-03-23

runners.breeder: B J Anderton Onzm & Mrs L E Anderton
runners.owner: A C Downing, S H Prenter Et Al

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Hurdle Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The plan was to jump in and get Absurde settled as he's had a tendency to be keen in the past. They went nice and fast early, so I didn't have any problems there and he settled well and jumped brilliantly. I thought Harry Skelton would take me into the race, so I followed him everywhere and winged the third-last and it was just a case of keeping him insulated either side up the home straight.  When you're on a horse with so much class it's easy. He's got so many options, you'd have a lot of fun owning him - Harry Cobden, rider.

Absurde ran a cracker considering he got shuffled back further than anticipated and Kerrin wanted to be. He had to ride the race presented to him and he rode a terrific race to get back up to be fifth. We'll keep coming back if we have the ammunition and I think Absurde will return. The owners are keen as they've had a wonderful time. We've bought a few new horses that might make into Melbourne Cup horses, so the quest is still on - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM County Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What a horse to travel the world and come back and put in a performance like that on that ground. It's funny because we hacked round, but that got them racing early enough because everyone was aware we were going so slow and wanted to get in a position. I thought Absurde would have the pace of them all on his Flat form and, if he handled the ground, he had a big chance, but the ground was a big worry. I was able to go out and take a chance and it's nice to be able to do that from time to time - Paul Townend, jockey.
I thought Absurde ran a cracker. He was in a position to win at one stage coming up the straight but didn't see it out - Willie Mullins, trainer.

Frankie's shown us what he can do. I thought Absurde was beaten half a furlong down but I don't know where Frankie got the energy to get him up in the last 100 yards. He pulled it out of the fire, he was brilliant. I'll have to have a word with the owners, who couldn't be here, and we'll see if they're interested in going down [under] but I'm sure they'd love to go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a long trip to Melbourne and ran great down there again. He might end up going out to Saudi Arabia for a valuable Flat race next. Maybe he still has a mark over hurdles which could see him repeat his exploits from Cheltenham last season in the County Hurdle. We'll see. 25-11-24

runners.breeder: Ecurie De Castillon, Sas I E I Et Al

quotes.quote: I think they go quicker in three-mile chases, don't they? River Of Stars ran a sound race and I'm really pleased with her. She's a tough filly. We'll probably go for the Park Hill now - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

River Of Stars is very tough and she stays well. It was a good opportunity for her. I'm glad she held on. She kept finding. The second horse came very late but she kept finding all the way to the line. I wasn't sure she had held on but I was hoping. She deserved that - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Bronte Cup Fillies' Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It played out well. If it wasn't River of Stars's first run of the year I'd have let her roll along. I had to sit into everyone at the top of the straight as she was a bit lairy, but she knew where the line was and stuck it out well. I wouldn't be surprised if she gets further too. Ralph's been aiming her at this and it's worked out lovely. She had a lot to turn around - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She's consistent and I'm sure something will fall her way again this year. She won the Bronte Cup at York last season and that is the obvious race for her in May. She likes the track and also ran well in last season's Lonsdale Cup. She'll need to improve again to step up in grade, which is possible given she's from a late-developing family. She's training well and is versatile. 15-04-24

runners.owner: R A Pegum, D L Mactaggart Et Al

prev_owners.owner: R A Pegum, P A Henry Et Al

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Registered As The Prestbury Juvenile Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The dream is always to come here for the Triumph Hurdle and be coming up the hill similar to how Scriptwriter did here. There's a long time between now and then but he's on the right path. I've believed in this horse since we bought him, especially after the first run (at Sedgefield) where, while he ran green, he showed he could jump. Paddy was extremely positive afterwards - Mark Adams, part-owner.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Scriptwriter went left and went right but he hit the line well. I would say this trip is his minimum - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a 102-rated Flat horse who didn't cost much relative to today's prices. He came from a great yard at Aidan O'Brien's but was probably galloping against very good horses and it was good for him to go to Sedgefield and get his head in front, although he's still green. He'll go for either the Summit Juvenile Hurdle at Doncaster, which we won last year with Knight Salute, or he'll go back to Cheltenham on December 10. I wouldn't want to run him on proper soft ground. Knight Salute won a Grade 1 and you'd be disappointed if this one wasn't a better horse ? he's well bred and has more size and scope, plus a better Flat rating. 20-11-22

We bought him out of Aidan O'Brien's yard having won over a mile. He has run once this season when mid-division in the Ballysax Stakes and, as you can imagine, he has a beautiful pedigree. His schooling has been good, and he should be out in the next three weeks. Very much one to look forward to. 13-10-22

quotes.quote: It's nice to see Goodie Two Shoes back in good form, she did it nicely. I'd say she will mix it between the Flat and hurdles. She had a hard fall at Fairyhouse that set her back a bit so it's good to see her back - Frank Berry, owner's racing manager.
Goodie Two Shoes learned a bit from Killarney and I would say that was a good performance, it rode a lot sharper today. 1m4f would suit her - Frank Berry, racing manager to J.P. McManus.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see her get off the mark over hurdles at Killarney. She doesn't want the ground too heavy so we'll have to pick the right spots for her, but I think she is capable of getting some black type over hurdles. 27-11-23

runners.owner: N C Williams, L J Williams Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

quotes.quote: Changingoftheguard ran a lovely race first time back. Ryan said he got a little bit tired in the soft ground but he was very happy with him. I'm not sure he really wants to go too far, maybe a mile and a half might be enough - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

Changingoftheguard wasn't at his best today but he kept going and I really needed a bit of help. He's a very honest horse who just gallops and he could have done with a bit of company - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Cazoo Derby (In Memory Of Lester Piggott) (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Changingoftheguard ran well and he keeps galloping. He's a solid horse that gallops well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

Aidan felt Changingoftheguard had improved substantially since his win in Dundalk and he obviously felt he was going to appreciate the step up in trip. We couldn't be happier with that. These trials are for everyone to find out what they've got and where they are and we now know with him. Will he run in the Derby? I would presume it's highly likely. Aidan will have to speak to the owners but why not? We all love the Derby and we want to win it. The more representation we have the better - Kevin Buckley, owner's UK representative.

stable_tour.quote: He won at the meeting last year and it's possible he'll join Point Lonsdale in the Hardwicke. He should come forward nicely from his return at Chester. 15-06-23

runners.owner: G A Rogerson, Todd Bawden Et Al

prev_owners.owner: G A Rogerson, C A Leishman Et Al
G A Rogerson, Todd Bawden Et Al
G A Rogerson, C A Leishman Et Al

quotes.quote: Onesmoothoperator just got too far back and then got hampered turning in. Nothing really went right for him but that's racing. We've had a great trip still as he's won. The last week hasn't been great with him pulling his shoe off and you want to go into these races at 100 per cent. Even though he didn't miss a lot of work, if you get a cut it still causes some issues - Brian Ellison, trainer.

I said to Craig [Williams] that Onesmoothoperator is not your normal stayer, he's got loads of speed and he's always had a good turn of foot. He gave him a great ride today and I think he's loved it here - he's been bouncing. He was too far back in the Ebor and nothing was coming from behind. The idea was to sit in the middle, but we got shuffled to the back and it was far too much to do. He still ran well and then we went to Kempton, but a mile and a half was too short because they went off slow. The winner has won a Group 1 and the horse behind us finished second in a Group 3, so the form has been really good - Brian Ellison, trainer, speaking to Racing.com.

I've been wanting to win it for a long time and I knew I had Onesmoothoperator right. They went a hell of a gallop and, when he's like that, he's some animal. Turning in I said, 'This has hacked up' and Connor said he could have won on the bridle - Brian Ellison, trainer.

Onesmoothoperator wasn't even going to run until it was switched here, he was going to go to Sedgefield over hurdles. They switched it here and it's been a lucky race for me, I've won it three times. He needs a good gallop and he got a brilliant ride. Ben made his move round the top bend and had everything covered - and you have to come up this rail. He's a funny ride because you have to take your time and ride him for luck. It's more than likely that he'll still go hurdling. He's a brilliant jumper and the one time we ran him they walked round and it was no good to him - Brian Ellison, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: If I've got a Northumberland Plate horse in the yard at this stage, it would be him. However, he's better over a mile and a half. He ran in the Plate two years ago and the surface was very deep, which is no good to him. It changes at Newcastle; when he won the November Handicap there it was riding quick. He ran well to finish second at Southwell last time. I love him - he turns up all the time. I think we'll go to Newcastle for all-weather finals day, probably for the mile-and-a-quarter race but he'll be in the two-mile race as well. There isn't a mile-and-a-half race then and we'll probably ride him a bit handier in the shorter race. He's in great form. He acts well on grass too as long as it's good ground. 03-04-24

runners.owner: OTI Racing, F W Cook Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Oti Racing, M Hay Et Al
OTI Management Pty Ltd, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

quotes.race: Jockey Club of Turkey Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shane (Crosse) said it was a good strong gallop all the way. What he liked about Point King was that he's usually had to be hard on him to win, but today he actually quickened up from two out and it was just hands and heels, waving the whip at him in the last furlong. He's improving all the time and seems to go on this sort of ground as well. He's a big horse but he floats on it. I don't know where he goes from here, that'll be up to Joseph. He's the most relaxed horse, and he's the same at home. You wouldn't know what's left in the tank - Brendan Powell, assistant to Joseph O'Brien, trainer

Point King is quite a big, raw, horse and stays very well. He stepped forward from his Fairyhouse run and he toughs it out good. I think he'll improve away into a good stayer. He's got the makings of a nice horse and hopefully he keeps going in that direction. It's nice to see that willing attitude - Shane Crosse, rider.

stable_tour.quote: The Copper Horse looks like it's going to be a very competitive race but he goes there with a live chance. He's been training well since his run at Leopardstown. 16-06-23

runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, S Tsalikidis Et Al

quotes.quote: Career best from Royal Supremacy. I'm very happy. There was a good speed on; I followed James Doyle, who was second, and it was worth supplementing him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.owner: OTI Racing, J P Spence Et Al
Mrs K McKay, P N McKay & S H R Davison

quotes.quote: Birdman is very green still. Thought he was going to pick up, maybe the ground was a little bit quick for him. It was a big step forward. He got stuck wide - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Yeats Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I would say Birdman\o will go for the Queen's Vase at Ascot now, that's the plan. We thought he would take the jump in class in his stride and that's what he's done. He goes on good ground and would go on quicker ground too. He's a great big baby and he's only a frame of a horse. He's still a work in progress - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

Birdman is a lovely horse and was very green. Shane couldn't even hit him as he didn't know what way he could go. Even at the stalls he didn't want to go near them because there was somebody in them. That will crown him and he is a nice horse - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Old Borough Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We weren't expecting Post Impressionist to do that as Tom said he didn't want to go early. I was hoping if that was the case they would go fast and they seemed to and he managed to pick them off. He ran a good race in the Ebor and he's in a terrific vein of form. He's probably up for another rise which will knock him out of any serious handicaps - William Haggas, trainer.
