A J A Bosma, Dr K L Samson Et Al
A Kheir, J A O'Neill Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Peter M Brant & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

quotes.quote: Interpretation is a hardy horse and he kept finding. He's lazy at home, just sleeps and eats, so you're never really sure what's in there. He won his maiden at the Curragh and the second has come out and won well after. He gets the trip well. He's solid, genuine and uncomplicated. We'll have to throw him into something next, we'll see what kind of mark he gets. We'll probably go for a stakes race next and the Vinnie Roe (1m6f at this track on August 12) would look a suitable option - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

Interpretation liked the ground. I think he'll stay further and have no problem with a mile and a half anyway. Those type of horses can progress and he went to the line with his ears pricked - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Langlais Bloodstock Et Al
runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, F W Cook Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Alexandre Foulon, Ecurie Vivaldi Et Al

runners.owner: Ballymore Stables (Aus) Pty Ltd, R & C Legh Racing P/L Et Al

quotes.quote: The last day Whisky On The Hill got caught out for a bit of pace between the 3f and 2f but today up in trip it was ideal and he did it very well. I followed the leaders, there was a lovely bit of pace and it worked out well. He's very genuine. He's been a big surprise, Ado (McGuinness) was half thinking of keeping him for bumpers but was afraid he wouldn't stay. Thank God he didn't, he's been a right horse this year - Adam Caffrey, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, S Tsalikidis Et Al

stable_tour.quote: He goes into quarantine in two weeks. I think the plan will be to run him in either the Cox Plate or the Caulfield Cup. We were very pleased with his run at Goodwood behind Jan Brueghel, as the ground was probably quicker than he'd want. He hadn't done masses of work before that race and how he went, including between the three-furlong marker and the one, was very good. It was a great bit of placing by Andrew Balding to win such a huge prize with Bellum Justum (second in the Gordon Stakes, just in front of our horse) over the weekend at Kentucky, and if you'd stopped the race a furlong out you'd have counted us the winner. He looked like the fastest horse in the race. He's rated 109 and Jan Bruegel could win the St Leger. We've had some good horses like Mugatoo, Rodrigo Dias and Red Cardinal for Australian Bloodstock and he looks to be another. 04-09-24"

runners.owner: P Preusker, B Tucker Et Al
OnTrack Mormona, Don't Tell Catherine Et Al
HM The King & HM The Queen
Blueblood T'Breds Syndicate, B B T Macheera Syndicate Et Al
Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al
C E Holt, M D Moncrieff Et Al
N C Williams, L J Williams Et Al

quotes.race: Paddy Power Stakes (Group 3) (Registered as the Kilternan Stakes)
quotes.quote: Adelaide River is a lovely, big horse and we always viewed him as a next year horse. We thought he could be like Duke Of Marmalade in that he is after competing in those big ones and went very close in them but he is such a big horse, is definitely going to have to be a way better horse next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

Adelaide River is a lovely colt. He always showed a bit at home. He was always the lazy one as well. He went out to the start today nice and sleepy, jumped a bit slow, but thankfully I had plenty of room to get up into a good position. He went down past the 2f pole well and went forward nice pricking his ears, he had plenty left - Wayne Lordon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He worked very well at the Curragh the other day. He's going to go to a Derby trial and could head to France for one. 06-04-23

runners.owner: Seymour Bloodstock, M A Pilkington Et Al
Myracehorse No 1, C E Holt Et Al

quotes.quote: Things didn't go right for Bur Dubai in the first half of the season and we could have done a few things better, but hopefully we have a promising horse for the second half. We always thought he was a nice horse. I probably didn't campaign him the best but today we let him use his stride and he's a big, strong horse.He picked up nicely and put the race to bed in good fashion. We let him bowl along in front and he stayed very well. I think he's a stayer in the making and he'll be able to stay a mile and six - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.owner: N C Williams, L J Williams Et Al

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor/D Smith/Mrs J Magnier/L J Williams Syndicate
Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

quotes.quote: We have always liked Cleveland and we always knew he was a very classy horse. He won his maiden late in the year at two and he didn't run at all at three, but we all thought that was a lovely run at Naas on his comeback and we were delighted with him. We weren't really sure how far he was going to stay so it was great to see him finish out his race the way he did and Ryan was very good on him. Obviously he has plenty of class and now we know he stays so Ascot will be the plan for him. He's in the big races there [Gold Cup and Hardwicke] and we'll see how he comes out of Chester before deciding which way we'll go - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a very good mover and good-looking horse, I'd say he's got a big future. Derby type. On his homework you'd have been scratching your head a bit but he got it together today and won well - Seamie Heffernan, rider of Cleveland

stable_tour.quote: He is currently in Australia and ran very well in his prep run in the Tancred Stakes. The Sydney Cup this weekend is his main target. 06-04-23

runners.owner: Wilde Racing, R W Gamble Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Wilde Racing, R W Gamble Et Al
Wilde Racing, D J Maclean Et Al

runners.owner: Proven Thoroughbreds, Proven Rogue Agent Et Al

stable_tour.quote: I probably shouldn't have run him in the Convivial Maiden at York as he was drawn 14 of 14 and he ducked out of the stalls and that was the race gone. He'd run well first time out when third at Sandown behind Arabian Crown. He's a nice horse and I need to find the right race for him to get back on track. He might go up to a mile next time, but he's always worked with plenty of speed so we'll see. 12-09-23

runners.owner: Australian Bloodstock, S Tsalikidis Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Noel Forgeard, P Bonnier Et Al
Ecurie Noel Forgeard, Earl Touchstone & P Bonnier

runners.owner: Highclere Thoroughbred Racing Australia Ltd, C S Dale Et Al

quotes.quote: Quietness has done really well. We're climbing the ladder and going up the weights and that was a good performance. It was a truly-run race, they went very quick, and she stays well.  It's onwards and upwards. I hope they'll keep her in training next year as she's a big, scopey filly.  I've got ideas of where she might go and the Park Hill Stakes is a possibility but she'll probably stay at a mile and a half because she's very effective at this trip - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

Quietness is grand and has done it well. She stays well and picked up in the straight. If she keeps going up the handicap, which she will, I wouldn't be afraid to go a mile and six with her - Joe Fanning, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

Quietness is new to me this year and she's a nice, scopey filly and we're very lucky to get her. Hopefully, she can win again. The handicapper will have his say, but she only just wins and if you stop riding, she stops going. I think we'll run her again fairly soon. She's better on faster ground - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

runners.owner: BK Racing & Breeding Pty Ltd, The Clan & Symphony Racing

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

quotes.quote: Star Of India did it nicely because they didn't go mad and he was still a bit green when he got to the front. He will improve, he's a very laid-back horse and I'd say we're only just getting to know what he can do, we're learning about him. He'll get better, there's no doubt about that. He was getting to the line very easily there. He's a nice type - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Star Of India is a grand staying type. We went a good gallop and I stayed going well. I like him - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lazy horse at home and even when we worked him at the Curragh to try to decide if he was more of a Guineas or a Derby type we didn't really get an answer. I needed to see what he would do when he got to the track, so we ran him in the Craven. He got outpaced after making the running, so it looks as if needs to go up in trip. It's still early days. 19-04-22

racecards.race_name: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 1)

quotes.quote: Al Qareem is a gentleman to ride, he tries very hard and I'm glad to win this sort of race three years in a row. He's got one style of running. He goes a good gallop and puts the rest of the horses under pressure from a very, very long way out. I knew the ground would suit us and we'd go a good gallop. A headwind like this doesn't help but my lad stays further and in the last two furlongs all I knew was I was going to hit the line quite strong. He's got a great mindset. You wouldn't mind if you had 50 horses like him, he makes things very easy for you - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Grand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Al Qareem is so honest and brave, and very sound. He just does it every time you ask him to. Even when the favourite came looming up, I had a little smile on my face when the commentator said he was coming at him as you know he's going to lengthen and keep finding. The Ebor I think he'd be handicapped out of it, but the Irish St Leger looks a perfect race for him. It's a lovely, big galloping track and stays the trip so well. There and the Curragh Cup are likely to be the next two races for him - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The ground, I felt like Al Qareem probably just got away with it today. All he does is gallop when you let him down - Clifford Lee, jockey.

I tried not to fire Al Qareem out of the gates, but he naturally jumps quickly anyway and going into the first bend he was half taking me on. I've got a lot of confidence in him and the petrol gauge never really fades. He just keeps galloping. He tries so hard and you know he's going to give you 150%. Even on the wrong ground he finishes on the backsides of the leaders, but he loves it when the going gets soft - Clifford Lee, jockey

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Al Qarem ran really well and he's a great horse to own. Every time you think you're going to have a quiet spell, up he pops and he puts a smile on our faces. We had him in the Irish St Leger and at various times during this week I thought we were going to run in Ireland, but I'm happy with the decision to run here. We're planning to run him twice again this season and he has options at Newmarket in a couple of Listed races and then we'll look at something else - Nick Bradley, part-owner.
All Al Qareem does is gallop and he loves these stiff finishes. I always thought I was going to get back up because my lad tries hard and keeps going - Clifford Lee, jockey.

Everything went right and Sam James gave Al Qareem a great ride. I thought we were overpriced but you never know coming off a break like that how they're going to run. He picked up an illness when flying from Dubai which hit him pretty hard. We thought we might not get him back on the track this year but Karl has done a brilliant job - Nick Bradley, syndicate manager.

We thought Al Qareem would win and he's been crying out for a step up in trip. He'll come into his own this season and the form of his Kempton fourth last year has worked out amazingly - Nick Bradley, managing director of owners.

stable_tour.quote: He probably bumped into a good one [Internaute] on his comeback at Saint-Cloud but showed all his battling qualities to win at Nottingham on Wednesday. I don't think he really sees out the two miles like a strong stayer but he definitely needs soft or heavy ground over a mile and a half, and the Ormonde at Chester's May meeting looks the obvious next step. 11-04-25

He was a huge improver last year with his handicap mark shooting up from 81 to 112 (31lb), which included victory in the Group 2 Prix Chaudenay (1m7f) under a cracking ride from Ryan Moore. We took him to Riyadh and Meydan earlier this year but he disappointed and I don't think the travelling suited him. He is having a break now and will be back for the second half of the season with the Ebor a likely target. 07-05-23

quotes.race: Longines Red Sea Turf Handicap (Group 2) (3yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Continuous ran very well. It was his first run back, so happy with him - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Continuous has loads of options. He could go to the Irish Champion Stakes or the Irish St Leger. He could run in the Irish Champion with a view to going to the Arc. He could go to the Japan Cup He is a very versatile horse and a great one to have. Dropping him back to this trip was not a worry. We decided we would take a lead today if we could. He could have popped out in front and done it all himself. He's a classy horse and an unusual type of horse and a very genuine horse. He can do it from 1m2f and possibly up to 2m - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I was very happy. We made the decision to take our time and relax, and Continuous dropped in lovely. The pace was very slow so they sprinted in the last two or three furlongs. He was coming through, but obviously the winner quickened up on the outside. He's probably best over a strongly run mile and a half. He could go to Japan, Hong Kong, America or Dubai. All those things are open to him. He's a ready-made four-year-old and we think the best is yet to come - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: You would say looking at him at York, he was nailed on for this race and he had form on soft ground. Continuous didn't have any problem with the trip. He's got a lot of class, you could see it in his work every day. We're over the moon. The lads will think about the Arc, I'd say, he handles soft ground and gets a mile and a half very well and has class. He has all the things that could work in an Arc. It's just whether the two-week turnback is too tight or not. He has a great constitution as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Continuous came here in the Dante and he needed the run badly and ran a massive race. I said to Ryan before the race would any of the other horses have run as well in Dante as he did and he said they wouldn't. A little bit of class usually outs, especially if the pace is even. We thought he handles an ease very well because he has a little bit of a round action but that was fast ground today and he didn't seem to have any problem with it. He bends his knee but obviously that's his best performance so you have to say he's very comfortable on it. I asked Ryan and he said he doesn't need a mile and six but you wouldn't rule him out - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV For Just 12 Euro A Month At racingtv.com Now Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Continuous is still a baby. He seems to stay well and he quickened up quite well. He's in the Beresford Stakes and that's a possibility for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the St Leger in 2023 and we've stepped him up in trip this year. He ran in the Dubai Gold Cup on Saturday but couldn't get into it from off the pace. 07-04-25

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't quite had enough rain, but Hamish hasn't run for three months and we thought the ground was safe enough. We're hoping to have a good autumn campaign with him, so we wanted to give him a good run. You get them fit for a first run and then you have to keep them at a certain level in case it rains, so they can run at any given moment, which is not so easy - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

Hamish was pretty naughty at the start but he's been crying out for a race for a long time. He needs soft ground and we haven't had any. He's been ready to go since the John Porter, which was the middle of April, so he was just pretty bored now and he needed a day out. I ride him every day and he doesn't feel like a nine-year-old, he feels great -  Maureen Haggas, trainer's assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Curragh On Course Bookmakers Finale Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Hamish did what you wanted to see. We got a nice run around from a good draw and everything went well - Richard Kingscote, rider.

quotes.race: Prix du Conseil de Paris (Group 2) (3yo+) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I thought Hamish ran really well. The winner is a very good horse and I never expected to beat him. To run as close to him as he did is great. We're really pleased. There's only one more race for him in England [the St Simon Stakes] but that's next Saturday, so it will come too quick. I don't know if there's anything left for him in France, but he loves soft ground and is in great form - Maureen Haggas, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Holland Cooper Coronation Cup (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled. Hamish could have done with more rain. It wasn't wet enough and I asked William this morning if we were doing the right thing but it might not rain for three months so you've got to run. He's like my pet and is a bloody star - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Finest Surprise Stakes (Registered As The John Porter Stakes) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I was delighted. Hamish doesn't really do a lot in front. The ground wasn't really soft enough, he had a 3lb penalty but he keeps winning. It'll be the Ormonde or the Yorkshire Cup - it always rains at Chester, so I suppose it'll be that next - William Haggas, trainer.

Hamish has been great. He needs that slow ground so it's never easy, but he's had his problems and we've needed to look after him. It's because he's been looked after that he's still able to do this. He's not easy. He was very naughty at Goodwood, he doesn't like it there, and he can be difficult. I was a bit worried about today but we saddled him in the stables and it's gone like clockwork, so I'm relieved really. He doesn't like Newbury either, so I was quite pleased the race was called off and he didn't go. I hope he'll be back next year, as long as he's in one piece. He has nothing to do other than be a racehorse, or my hack, and I think he'd rather be a racehorse - Maureen Haggas, trainer's assistant and wife.
Hamish won't run in the Ebor. He's hard to place. The Irish St Leger is a possibility, but he wants soft ground - William Haggas, trainer.

Hamish is a great horse and he got Tom out of a bit of trouble today. He's in the Irish St Leger, he's in everything in case it rains. He handles really horrible conditions whereas a lot of the classier horses don't. We'll see what the weather does and go where the ground suits him - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Peroni Nastro Azzurro Cumberland Lodge Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: There's the St Simon Stakes for Hamish, but I don't know about the penalties for that. We'll see, but he loves this soft ground - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Proud To Support Chester Racecourse Ormonde Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Hamish has done really well because he was a little bit fresh and would have needed it. We haven't been on the grass at all because the ground has been so firm. He had the penalty as well. I walked the course and thought it couldn't be that bad with the rain yesterday and it's going to be better than York next week. I'd imagine he'd go for the Hardwicke but we'll see because it all depends on the ground and if it's firm he won't be going anywhere - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

Hamish was fit and well but has obviously been off the track for a long time and was a bit fresh and gassy today. He's a talented horse. He had great form as a 3yo and ran a really good race in the Hardwicke last year, where unfortunately he picked up his tendon injury. He needs soft ground and we ran him today as we needed to get out and give him a race as he was ready to go. We aim at the stayers' race on Champions Day at Ascot and work back from that -Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

Hamish was giving away lumps of weight and he's done it well really. I thought the ground might be a bit quick for him in the Melrose but he won regardless. I think he's at his best on slower ground, like a lot of the family. I wouldn't have thought he'll run again this year, he's won two nice races now - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

quotes.quote: We thought Illinois would be a Gold Cup horse next year, and obviously it was the plan Kyprios would come here this year and he would step up next year. The plan was for him to go to the Coronation [Cup] and I was training him as a good mile and a half-horse, and then when Kyprios retired we switched him to this race. We have to be happy with the run and he had a lovely preparation the last day. Maybe if we knew he was coming here straightaway, we might have had him going earlier and maybe lighter. He might go to Goodwood and meet this horse again and I would imagine he will progress again then. He got tired at the two-furlong pole today, like a lot of horses do, and we will see if we can improve him another little bit for this distance. It shows how good Kyprios was as Trawlerman had been second to him a couple of times, I think - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Big-Value You Can Bet On Ormonde Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That was very pleasing, he's a lovely horse. Illinois is a big, fine, strong animal so he will improve for the run. Ryan was very happy with him. He was waiting for someone at the bend to take him there and they didn't so he just had to go. He was just playing around in front at the end there but he's a lovely horse. He's very versatile. We've just been talking to Aidan and you could drop him back in trip for the Coronation Cup or you could step him up to Cup races. He'd do whatever you want for you. You can see what he did last year, he's a proper horse. He's a two-time Group 2 winner and carried the penalty today and did it really well. He's a lovely horse to have, we're lucky - Paul Smith, representing the owners.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: They are two very good horses and clearly there's nothing between them. Sean gave the winner a very good ride and neither stopped all the way down the straight. We knew the winner had improved a lot since Goodwood and he's a classy horse. Either of them could go to Melbourne, they're two classy stayers but Illinois would have no problem coming back to a mile and a half - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Great Voltigeur Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Illinois stays very well and looked like he was going to lose second, but fought back and that usually suggests that he wants that staying trip, as he showed at Ascot too - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

We felt any of the three could win. Ryan made the decision to ride Illinois, and he had the choice of the King Edward VII Stakes or this race. He's obviously a St Leger-type horse and is going to improve from three to four. He's a bit of a baby mentally still, so he might have a little rest now and maybe go to York on the way to the Leger, something like that. I think he might have a little bit more class than a Cup horse. His sister won the Arc, so he's that type  - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

Illinois ran a lovely race and just got a bit tired in the deep ground. He was working lovely, but he's a big horse and we didn't want to over-squeeze him for his first run because we felt the season was going to be long for him. We've often felt with those type of horses that if you over-squeeze them early in the season, it can catch you in the middle of the season so we just had him ready to run and he ran a lovely race. Ryan said he struggled in the ground and he will come forward a lot from it - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.
Ryan was very happy with Illinois. He's still a baby and will improve plenty - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Shoda Market Cafe Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Illinois is a beautiful colt. There's not too many that when you go down past the two and a half, they say point me. I actually got there too soon because I thought he'd take a bit of stoking. He has a lot going for him - pedigree, scope, size, action, wind. He was pretty much a steering job and I'm going to miss these Galileos - Seamie Heffernan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was always there to slot in if anything happened to Kyprios and that's what has happened. Everything has gone well in the build-up. We were delighted with him at Chester as we felt he would come on a lot for it ? he hadn't run since the autumn. The thing about Illinois is that he stays very well but he's got a bit of class to go with it, and that's what you need in a Gold Cup. You never know for sure whether they will stay the Gold Cup trip until you try it. Once you go beyond two miles, you're entering unknown territory. We'll find out at the same time as everyone else, but we always thought he would stay. We've been delighted with him at home over the last few weeks. 13-06-25

runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

quotes.quote: Jan Brueghel is very tough and Ryan [Moore] gave him a class ride, but you know he doesn't surrender. He'd improved a lot from the last day, and you could see he was pricking his ears at the finish. He ran a lovely race first time back when it was only a mile and a quarter and he got beat by a good horse of Joseph's [O'Brien]. It was a bit unfair to pitch him in early over a mile and a quarter, but we just needed to get him out. He's a very brave horse and if you pass him slowly, you're in trouble. Ryan gave him an incredible ride, balanced him and got him in a lovely rhythm, and you can see him starting to come from a long way out. Everyone knew before the race that it was going to be a good gallop, and Wayne [Lordan, on Continuous] was there to make sure it was a good gallop. All anyone wanted was for it to be a solidly run, evenly run race, and then we'd see. Then we'd know after the race what to do next, what distance to go for next time, what to not do. The worst thing is when you come out of a race and you say, 'But if they'd gone a good pace, then?' that's a problem for everybody. He's a very good tough horse who was unbeaten last year, and he'd still be unbeaten if I hadn't run him too early at The Curragh this year. - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.Jan Brueghel stays this trip very well and he's an uncomplicated horse. Aidan had him, as he always does, in unbelievable shape. He showed a great attitude. The second horse is a very talented horse and I am sure he'll win a big race soon. The ground, being just on the slower side of good, suited him and he stayed on really well - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We knew the track would suit and the trip would suit. I think Jan Brueghel showed he's successful going that extra distance and I think he's a Gold Cup horse in the making. Don't be surprised if he steps up a bit next year, But he has a bit of class and he's done that really well - Sean Levey, rider.

Jan Brueghel was very green. I didn't really want to make the running because he was a bit raw. The horse in front stopped and I was kind of left there and he was waiting. It was a difficult track for him and he's carried a penalty too, so you'd have to be happy with what he's done. He'll get better still. There's definitely more class in there, you've just got to get it out of him - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We were worried about the ground for Jan Brueghel. We knew he had improved a lot from the last day and that he'd stay further but we weren't sure about the ground. You could see him changing legs when he turned in. He will stay much further and will be very happy going a mile and a half. We were thinking of coming here and then on to Goodwood and then going to the Leger - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: McDonnells Bar Newbridge Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Jan Brueghel just wasn't straightforward to train, he took a bit of time, he's a big horse. He's probably a fair horse - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a very good three-year-old campaign, winning all of his four starts including the St Leger. He's very well and working very well but he's going to have to stand in line behind Kyprios this season I'd imagine. He could have a run before the Hardwicke at Royal Ascot because if Kyprios is there in the Gold Cup there's probably no point in any of ours running against him. He's definitely a mile-and-a-half-plus horse, even though he won a Group race over a mile and a quarter. 07-04-25

quotes.quote: Kyle Of Lochalsh is really filling into his frame now, so a move up to pattern company can suit him nicely and something like the Cadran or even the Prix Royal-Oak later on. This is only his second run this season, so hopefully there's a bit of mileage left - Charlie Harris, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai "City Bowl" Handicap
quotes.quote: Hughie [Morrison, trainer] was a bit worried about the ground but Kyle Of Lochalsh managed to get the job done nicely. Considering he handles this ground it could open up some options for him. I think he could climb through the ranks - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He did really well last year. He won only once but was placed many times, including at Royal Ascot in the Ascot Stakes and in a Listed race in France after that. However, as a result of that, he's now rated 97 and is difficult to place, so you're looking for specifics - he definitely needs soft ground. We need to try to find the right race for him but it won't be easy as we seem to have lost a Listed race or two from the calendar. There's one at the beginning of July at Sandown on Eclipse weekend and that might be the sort of race for him if the ground is right. He could go for the Ascot Stakes again and he might get an entry in the Queen Alexandra on the basis that it might rain at the end of the week, but I don't know whether he'll stay virtually 2m6f. 29-05-25

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

quotes.quote: On paper Sibayan was the best horse in the race. The beginning of the race was messy and it took some time to decide where everyone was going to sit, but he picked up very well in the end - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

runners.owner: Guy Pariente Holding & Qatar Racing Ltd

quotes.race: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Sunway ran an absolute stormer. As usual, he ran his heart out. He just found a couple of better ones today. He could run again, we gave him a break so I assume he'll keep on going but I'm not sure where he'll run - David Menuisier, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish Derby (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: That's the third Classic I've lost by less than a length this season so I'm used to it now! I'm delighted with Sunway, we've always thought the world of him. People lost faith in the horse and today he vindicated himself and showed that he's a really classy act - David Menuisier, trainer.

Sunway hung in there because of his talent, but I think he's run a long way below form. The reason for that I just don't know. I know the form of the horses he's been working with and even compared to a horse like Tamfana, it's night and day. They don't work together, but Oisin came to work this horse and Devil's Point the other day, and we both know that Sunway has enormous potential. I may not have won 50 Group 1s, but I know a good horse - David Menuisier, trainer.

It's a lovely story and goes back to May, when Oisin came down to ride Sunway. When he came back from cantering him, he didn't say a word. I was beginning to worry I'd been mistaken about how good he was, but then Oisin said, 'He's the best 2yo I've ridden this year.' Bearing in mind he's sat on 2yos, I've thought ever since that we had a proper one. I was worried about Alcantor, but on this ground he was maybe a little less decisive in terms of his acceleration. Going forward, I think Sunway is a colt for the Classics and he should stay a mile and a quarter and perhaps a mile and a half - David Menuisier, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran in the Goodwood Cup on Tuesday and was beaten about four lengths in fourth. He ran a stormer in the Hardwicke at Royal Ascot and came out of it really well, and he'd shaped nicely when third in the St Leger last year, which  had led us to believe he could go there with a decent shot. 30-07-25

quotes.race: Betfred Howard Wright Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: It's lovely to win this race with Sweet William. It's in memory of Howard Wright who was a great friend of all of us. He was a super fellow, great for racing - we need him back again. I've already been instructed that's it for the season. See you this time next season, same place. Philippa Cooper [owner] wants to go out on a high and build up to the Doncaster Cup next year. They're great these Cup horses, people remember them and enjoy them. Stradivarius, this horse and Trawlerman are exciting for crowds because a lot of our Flat horses disappear too quickly - John Gosden, trainer.
Sweet William will go to Doncaster and that will be it for the year - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

Sweet William will go to York and Doncaster now. A galloping track suits him, maybe a fiddly one like this doesn't. Aidan's runners controlled the early fractions. When they do that, they're very hard to catch - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Sweet William and Trawlerman both ran well. They controlled the pace upfront, both of Aidan's horses. The fractions were pretty steady and then they gradually increased and kicked off the bend. Ours would probably have preferred a stronger, even pace. They've run exceptionally well but Kyprios has a gear more than the rest. I'd have thought we'd come back with both of them next year. They're lovely horses. They both have great enthusiasm for it still and these long-distance horses make it fun - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Howard Wright Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We've been mucking about with different things and Sweet William seems to be really enjoying it at the minute. We had a visor on and we made the slits slightly bigger so he could see a little bit - just changing things and keeping him interested. He never lets you down but it's nice when he asserts himself like that. He's deserved a big one. He's been in the first three in some top race races - Robert Havlin, rider.

Sweet William has had seven screws in his leg so what a courageous horse. That's why we love him and he's a character. He was box-rested for four months when he was two and he had a hell of a time. I never thought of him being a racehorse, I just wanted him to live. He's the most beautiful horse I've bred and he's named after my son. It's wonderful to be third in a Group 1 and my children don't come racing very often so for them both to run well is wonderful - Philippa Cooper.

It was Philippa's [Cooper, owner] idea to put the visor on Sweet William. We put full-cup blinkers on him last year and he never travelled a yard. He didn't really travel today, to be honest, but the further he went, the better he went. He'll definitely stay two and a half miles and he'll go to Ascot now. He's had a good blow today. He's only run over further than two miles once at Doncaster and it wasn't a test because it turned into a three-furlong sprint. It worked out the way I thought it would in my head. I thought I would let Rossa [Ryan] on Caius Chorister lead me this time because he pounced on me last time. I was able to play with him a little bit up the straight - Rab Havlin, jockey.

Sweet William is becoming more straightforward. He has been a lot of fun to train and it was a long time until he could race for various reasons. He does have a strong view on life and it is not necessarily where you want him to go! He is getting the idea of it well now. The York Ebor meeting might nearly be my favourite meeting of the year, but we have got to get in the race, that's the thing, it will be touch and go. If not, he is a horse who might one day step up the ladder to Cup races - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

We'll take it one race at a time but I think Sweet William would need another penalty to get into the Ebor, and these big handicaps aren't my bag to be honest, but John and Thady Gosden have helped so much with this horse's journey and they will decide - Philippa Cooper, owner/breeder.
We'll freshen Trawlerman up and he'll run one more time this year at Ascot on Champions day - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

Trawlerman did it in the Henry II and I said to William [Buick] 'try and do the same, set your own pace, pick it up all the way'. He's such a lovely horse. Sweet William didn't quite stay, he's a two and a quarter-mile horse. I said 'look, it's the golden rule, when they come by you they know they've been in a two and a half-mile race' and they never got to him. There's no point going steady like we did in Dubai. I didn't enjoy it [the final furlong] because anything can happen, you never know until they cross the line - John Gosden, joint-trainer.Trawlerman is a great horse. We tried it [same tactics] last year and we were only beaten by the great Kyprios. He's been such a good horse, he's so genuine. John and Thady's [Gosden] horses are in great shape. I was so happy with this fellow when he won at Sandown so he had a beautiful prep into this and he was just so smooth throughout the race; he's really what you want in a two and a half-mile race. I didn't have to touch the brakes once, he was in a nice rhythm and he was relaxed; he went on autopilot, he knows his own speed and he stays well so I was just a passenger. First Gold Cup, it's been a long time coming and it's not an easy race to win - William Buick, jockey.

It was a small field and the plan was just to go to the front with Trawlerman and just let him find a rhythm, which William [Buick] did very well. Last year we gave him a full break from Dubai until Ascot, but this time we thought a prep run would suit him well. He's not having an overly hard blow and he did it well. It's unfortunate news for Ballymore about Kyprios, no one likes to see a horse retired especially at the start of the Flat season, but of course it changes the dynamics of the staying division this year. Trawlerman wears his heart on his sleeve every time and he's part of the furniture now. He's a cracking old boy now and hopefully he can win a big one at some point - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

Trawlerman was foot-perfect the whole way and when I turned in I thought I had plenty of horse. He kept finding all the way to the line and even when the winner headed me, he came back. It was a huge run and he stayed the trip. I'm sure that [Goodwood] will be his next target. The winner's been there and done it before so you've got to respect him but Trawlerman's run a mighty race - William Buick, jockey.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: When he [Kyprios] passed me comfortably, I thought he was going to win by a few lengths but when he couldn't get away from me, I thought that maybe there's a little bit left here. In fairness, Trawlerman was a professional today and a great battler - Frankie Dettori, rider.

quotes.race: Jockey Club Rose Bowl Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Rose Bowl is a nice race to win and we'll have another go at the Ascot race. Trawlerman has to go down early as he takes such a strong grip - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

We did that with Trawlerman's sire Golden Horn in the Arc, we did it with Muntahaa in this race and we've done it again here. Once you get that draw you should just stay out there. It works. It was very much a team decision. As soon as we got that draw we knew what we were going to do. So long as you mind your own business, you're fine. You just don't want the horse to turn right and go into the stables. You had to fancy him to run a big race after his run at Goodwood. I felt very strongly that he was the right horse for the day - John Gosden, joint-trainer.

Trawlerman ran last time at Newmarket and he is over generous. He leans on the rider a bit and doesn't give them much of a chance usually. Obviously he had the hood on today, which helped him a lot, but Benoit gave him a great ride and every time he felt a horse coming to him at the end, he pulled out a little bit more. We were trying to run him in a race that had a big enough field to try and get him settled. He is such a genuine horse, he gives you everything when you ask for it. Hopefully the hood relaxes him a bit and lets him enjoy the quality he has - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF "High-Rise" Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Trawlerman has obviously learned from his first two runs and he was pretty push-button round there, it was a nice step forward - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

quotes.race: William Hill Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a nice horse and has always been held in high regard. He's done well because running downhill on this ground probably wasn't ideal for him. Stay True is a lovely horse also and will be going forward. I'd be happy with both of them. They're all very good horses and there's nobody like Aidan to train a horse, so I'm very lucky - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back If 2nd To SP Fav Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a lovely colt. He had a lovely run at Killarney, running green but finishing out well. Today he was very professional. He jumped, travelled, and I thought he quickened up well. He had a look when he got there but he went to the line well and he has a bit of class - Wayne Lordan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good staying colt who showed he was tough and hardy when winning the Lingfield Derby Trial. Ryan liked him that day and the plan was always to come here next. He seems well and seems to stay well. 13-06-25

runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Camas Park Stud
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Reserve; stepped up in trip for winning h'cap debut; up 8lb but player with a run
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; showed similar form in a trio of maidens in which he placed; stepped up to 1m6f on heavy ground for his handicap debut at Listowel, where he bagged his first win; player if he gets a run but 3lb wrong.

runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

quotes.quote: I'm delighted, Scandinavia is hardy and Tom gave him a great ride. He stays very well obviously, but we were a little bit worried when the ground went on the slow side. The better the ground, the better you'll see him. He has a beautiful temperament and he stays, but he'll probably have no problem coming back to a mile and a half as he has loads of gears. Every week he's getting better. He's in the Melbourne Cup and he has to get scanned to see whether he's eligible to go or not, but there's every chance the lads might want to go down there with him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

We're delighted. This was Illinois's race, all was planned out, but when Ryan [Moore] said at Newmarket that Scandinavia felt very classy, it was the right thing to do to let them come and run the two of them together and see. Scandinavia looks a very classy stayer, he travelled very well through the race and Wayne [Lordan] gave him a beautiful ride. He was always a very smart horse. The lads actually backed him for the Derby very early in his career, he was considered a very good horse. He won his maiden over a mile and a quarter and Wayne was delighted with him at Ascot next time - he got trapped six wide but he still didn't lie down the whole way and came back at the line to try and win. He's a great stayer with a great mind, he's uncomplicated, and like we saw today he handled the ease in the ground well. You couldn't be more delighted with him really. You would imagine he looks a ready-made Leger horse. Lambourn didn't go to the King George, he is looking at the Voltigeur, and after that an Arc or the British or Irish Leger after that. Scandinavia doesn't have to run again before the Leger if he's going there, so all the options are there - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.Scandinavia has improved all year. He was stepping up to two miles today against the older horses. It's a tough task but I thought he stepped forward quite well. He was hanging onto a little bit even when he got there so I think there's plenty of improvement to come. Today was going to find out how smart he is and he's obviously a very smart stayer - Wayne Lordan, jockey.

I think the St Leger in England, or Ireland, would be targets and then hopefully Scandinavia can develop into a cup horse for next year. We can plot our way to those nice staying races for the rest of the year. We'll see how the horses perform over the festivals at Goodwood and York. He seems to have improved again since Ascot. Hopefully now we can have some fun with him over these longer distances - Paul Smith, co-owner.Scandinavia has been improving with every race and ran well at Ascot. He got into a lovely rhythm today and stayed on really well. I never rode him in a race before although I have rode him at home, so I wouldn't know about the [first-time] cheekpieces. He was impressive today - Ryan Moore, jockey.

runners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

quotes.race: Trainor Stone And Tile Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Shackleton disappointed us last day but Ryan was very happy with him today. He was very green in front and the conditions were tough. He's a middle distance horse for next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We think a step up in trip will definitely help him. It was his first run back in the Gallinule at the Curragh last month and we knew he might need it. He seems to be coming forward nicely and he stays well, so the Queen's Vase will suit him well, we hope. 13-06-25

quotes.quote: Tennessee Stud is just a very good horse. He always has been. The Prix Niel wasn't really his thing last time and we felt he was ready to step up in trip. He's lovely and relaxed, especially for a colt. He always gave the impression that he had the temperament and the pedigree to become a stayer. He could be a Melbourne Cup horse. I was impressed with him today. I know he didn't win by far, but Dylan [Browne McMonagle] felt he was getting quite lonely in the final furlong, which is just the way the race panned out - Kevin Blake, trainer's representative. Tennessee Stud travelled round well and quickened better than I expected to in the conditions and left me clear with a target on my back, but he was tough until the line. He's a top-class horse over that trip. The ground is proper soft and a bit slower in places. It's breezy as well so the conditions are tough - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (In Honour Of His Highness Aga Khan IV) (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Tennessee Stud ran great. He was a little bit slower into his stride than we maybe expected, but it was a really good run. Very proud of the horse, a great ride from Dylan and I'm delighted for all of the owners - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

Dylan [Browne McMonagle, jockey] gave Tennessee Stud a fantastic ride, he said he was really struggling on that ground and he never felt comfortable at any stage. I think it's quite heavy there. It's testament to his attitude he was able to fight and fight and still win at the line. He's very big and I expect him to be better as a three-year-old. He'll have a break and he'll be trained now with the Derby at Epsom being his target. He could run in one or two trial races - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Camas Park Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Tennessee Stud has sharpened up a lot and did well. He's a good staying horse and a Derby Trial horse for next season - Declan McDonogh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Criterium de Saint-Cloud on his last start and the feeling here was that he did it despite the ground as it was a real slog that day. He's wintered very well and has matured and progressed so we're very excited about him. He ran late last year so it was always the plan to miss the early Derby trials this season. He'll go to Leopardstown on May 11 for the Derby trial and from there on to Epsom. His pedigree has plenty of pace in it and is really more of a mile pedigree, even though he's out of a Sadler's Wells mare, so it wouldn't be absolutely guaranteed he'd get a mile and a half. We'll evaluate it after Leopardstown and Epsom. 24-04-25
